definition: to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Lie on your back with your legs spread or raise your knees to your head.
sentences.chinese: 平躺，張開雙腿或者把膝蓋擡到靠近頭部的地方。

sentences.english: Ten nets are exquisite and regular, seemlingly having gained mercy of gods.
sentences.chinese: 網織的精巧而規矩，八卦形的張開，彷彿得到神主。

sentences.english: Hyperechoic incisor teeth can be seen in the opened mouth.
sentences.chinese: 可以看到張開的口中的強回聲的門齒。

sentences.english: Qin Shan people, with great mind, are stretch out their arms greeting friends from all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 秦山人以博大胸懷，張開雙臂迎接世界朋友的到來。

sentences.english: So dear friends , let's open our hearts and ears to enjoy music .
sentences.chinese: 親愛的朋友，讓我們敞開心靈和張開雙耳去感受音樂。

sentences.english: When shocked, she opens her mouth as she knits her brows.
sentences.chinese: 當她震驚的時候，她會張開嘴巴，同時皺起眉頭。

sentences.english: At once she changed into a crane and opening her beautiful wings, she flew up into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 阿姿即刻變成了一隻鶴，張開漂亮的翅膀飛向天空。

sentences.english: Attempt to do me awake all the way, Xinxin Ran opened his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一切都像剛睡醒的樣子，欣欣然張開了眼。

sentences.english: Mr. Swiveller looked, as he was, all open mouthed astonishment.
sentences.chinese: 斯威夫勒先生驚異得張開了嘴。

sentences.english: Personally, I would welcome such a policy imperative with wide-open arms.
sentences.chinese: 我個人張開雙臂歡迎這種必要的政策目標。

sentences.english: A short, spikey style is a short hairstyle that gives you a modern and edgy look.
sentences.chinese: 短而向四外張開的髮式讓你看起來更時尚和充滿活力。

sentences.english: All look like the appearance which just awoke, joyfully opened joyful enlarged ones vision.
sentences.chinese: 一切都象剛睡醒的樣子，欣欣然張開了眼。

sentences.english: Pleas open your hand. Press it with this bit of cotton wool for a while.
sentences.chinese: 請張開手，用這塊棉花壓一會兒。

sentences.english: Open your mouth, dear. We're going to take your temperature.
sentences.chinese: 張開嘴，親愛的，我幫你量一量體溫。

sentences.english: We have simply used nature's ways to open up the magnetosphere without benefit of storm.
sentences.chinese: 我們只不過運用自然的方式張開磁層，而非利用風暴。

sentences.english: Marti opened her eyes to see Mrs. Allen, the school nurse, standing over her.
sentences.chinese: 瑪蒂張開眼睛，看到護士艾倫太太站在她身邊。

definition: to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to open one's mouth (to eat, speak etc)/to gape/to start talking (esp. to make a request)
